How can I sort the following list in descending order using Scala?
List("Apple", "Banana", "Orange", "Grapes")

To sort a list of strings in descending order in Scala, you can use the `sortWith` method. Here's how you can sort the given list:

```scala
val fruits = List("Apple", "Banana", "Orange", "Grapes")
val sortedFruits = fruits.sortWith(_ > _)
println(sortedFruits)
```

This code snippet sorts the list of fruits in descending order by using `sortWith` and providing a comparison function `_ > _`, which compares the elements in reverse order. When you run this code, it will display the sorted list as follows:

```
List(Orange, Grapes, Banana, Apple)
```

This is the list sorted in descending alphabetical order.
